snippet: New companies are partnering with universities to offer online courses, in an effort that could define the future of higher education — if anyone can figure out how to make money.
abstract: New companies are partnering with universities to offer free massive open online courses, or MOOCs, in fast-growing effort that could define future of higher education, but many are not sure if venture will ever turn a profit; Coursera, current industry front-runner, is seeking to earn some short-term revenue through licensing fees from other educational institutions (Series: Virtual U).
lead_paragraph: New companies are partnering with universities to offer online courses, in an effort that could define the future of higher education — if anyone can figure out how to make money.

headline.print_headline: Students Rush to Web Classes, But Profits May Be Much Later
headline.seo: Massive Open Online Courses Prove Popular, if Not Lucrative Yet
headline.main: Students Rush to Web Classes, but Profits May Be Much Later
